p.s: In this given extract from the drama Romeo and Juliet, published by Oxford school Shakespeare in 2008, Romeo meets Juliet again at her balcony, after their first meeting at the ball.
At first, Juliet is very concerned about Romeo, while also wondering how he found her.
So she questions Romeo, how he got over the walls, that are surrondingsurrounding her Househouse and warns him, that he will be killed if anyone sees him, considering what family he stems from.
Romeo just responds that stone walls are not enough to stop love and that it can overcome anything that stands in its way, including JulietsJuliet's relatives.
Juliet then again warns him that if seen he will be killed by the Capulets.
Romeo answers by saying that in Juliet's eyes lies more danger than in twenty enemysenemies and that her appreciation is enough to guard him from enemysenemies.
Juliet then again underlines her concerns of Romeo being seen.
Romeo'srespondreponse to this is, that the darkness of the night hides him from others and if Juliet didn't love him, he would be better off dead anyways.
When Juliet asks him, how he found her, Romeo says that love guided him and that he would go anywhere to find her.
Lastly, Juliet questions whether Romeo really loves her, while also admitting to her love for him.
Romeo then tries reinforce his love swearing to the moon, which is not enough for Juliet, so she stells him to swear by himself.
